original_text: Half metallic ferromagnets (HMF) have attracted enormous interest due to their applications in spintronic devices [1]. Dilute magnetic semiconductors (DMSs) are considered to be the best materials to show half metallicity. These materials have two components, one being a semiconducting material with diamagnetic properties while the other is a magnetic dopant such as transition metal having un-paired d electrons [2]. The major advantage of these materials is utilization of electrons spin as information carrier since advanced functionalities in spintronic devices can be viable by the use of spin degree of freedom along with the charge of electrons [3]. The major issue regarding the applicability of these materials is to enhance the Curie temperature above room temperature. Thats why the research interest shifted towards large band gap materials. A lot of work has been reported on DMSs with different II–VI and III–V semiconductors as host material such as, ZnS, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4–12].
original_translation: Los ferromagnetos semimetálicos (HMF) han atraído un enorme interés debido a sus aplicaciones en dispositivos espintrónicos [1]. Los semiconductores magnéticos diluidos (DMS) son considerados los mejores materiales para mostrar semimetálicidad. Estos materiales tienen dos componentes, uno siendo un material semiconductivo con propiedades diamagnéticas mientras que el otro es un dopante magnético como un metal de transición que tiene electrones d desapareados [2]. La principal ventaja de estos materiales es la utilización del espín de los electrones como portador de información, ya que las funcionalidades avanzadas en dispositivos espintrónicos pueden ser viables mediante el uso del grado de libertad de espín junto con la carga de los electrones [3]. El principal problema con respecto a la aplicabilidad de estos materiales es aumentar la temperatura de Curie por encima de la temperatura ambiente. Por eso, el interés de la investigación se desplazó hacia materiales con una gran brecha de energía. Se ha informado de mucho trabajo sobre DMSs con diferentes semiconductores II-VI y III-V como material anfitrión, como ZnS, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4-12].

Dilute magnetic semiconductors (DMSs) are considered to be the best materials to show half metallicity.
These materials have two components, one being a semiconducting material with diamagnetic properties while the other is a magnetic dopant such as transition metal having un-paired d electrons [2].

The major advantage of these materials is utilization of electrons spin as information carrier since advanced functionalities in spintronic devices can be viable by the use of spin degree of freedom along with the charge of electrons [3].
The major issue regarding the applicability of these materials is to enhance the Curie temperature above room temperature.
Thats why the research interest shifted towards large band gap materials.
A lot of work has been reported on DMSs with different II–VI and III–V semiconductors as host material such as, ZnS, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4–12].

El principal problema con respecto a la aplicabilidad de estos materiales es aumentar la temperatura de Curie por encima de la temperatura ambiente. Por eso, el interés de la investigación se desplazó hacia materiales con una gran brecha de energía. Output: Se ha informado de mucho trabajo sobre DMSs con diferentes
semiconductores II-VI y III-V
como material base, como ZnS, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4-12].

Dilute magnetic semiconductors (DMSs) are considered to be the best materials to show half metallicity.
These materials have two components, one being a semiconducting material with diamagnetic properties while the other is a magnetic dopant such as transition metal having un-paired d electrons [2].

The major advantage of these materials is utilization of electrons spin as information carrier since advanced functionalities in spintronic devices can be viable by the use of spin degree of freedom along with the charge of electrons [3].
The major issue regarding the applicability of these materials is to enhance the Curie temperature above room temperature.

Thats why the research interest shifted towards
large band gap materials
.
A lot of work has been reported on DMSs with different II–VI and III–V semiconductors as host material such as, ZnS, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4–12].

Los ferromagnetos semimetálicos (HMF) han atraído un enorme interés debido a sus aplicaciones en dispositivos espintrónicos [1]. Los semiconductores magnéticos diluidos (DMS) son considerados los mejores materiales para mostrar semimetálicidad. Estos materiales tienen dos componentes, uno siendo un material semiconductivo con propiedades diamagnéticas mientras que el otro es un dopante magnético como un metal de transición que tiene electrones d desapareados [2]. La principal ventaja de estos materiales es la utilización del espín de los electrones como portador de información, ya que las funcionalidades avanzadas en dispositivos espintrónicos pueden ser viables mediante el uso del grado de libertad de espín junto con la carga de los electrones [3]. El principal problema con respecto a la aplicabilidad de estos materiales es aumentar la temperatura de Curie por encima de la temperatura ambiente. Por eso, el interés de la investigación se desplazó hacia materiales con una gran brecha de energía. Output: Se ha informado de mucho trabajo sobre DMSs con diferentes semiconductores de II-VI y III-V como material base, como ZnS, CdS, GaN,
ZnO
, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4–12].

original_annotated_sentences: Half metallic ferromagnets (HMF) have attracted enormous interest due to their applications in spintronic devices [1].
Dilute magnetic semiconductors (DMSs) are considered to be the best materials to show half metallicity.
These materials have two components, one being a semiconducting material with diamagnetic properties while the other is a magnetic dopant such as transition metal having un-paired d electrons [2].

The major advantage of these materials is utilization of electrons spin as information carrier since advanced functionalities in spintronic devices can be viable by the use of spin degree of freedom along with the charge of electrons [3].
The major issue regarding the applicability of these materials is to enhance the Curie temperature above room temperature.
Thats why the research interest shifted towards large band gap materials.

A lot of work has been reported on DMSs with different II–VI and III–V semiconductors as host material such as,
ZnS
, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4–12].
original_annotated_samples:
A lot of work has been reported on DMSs with different II–VI and III–V semiconductors as host material such as,
ZnS
, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4–12].
translated_annotated_samples:
Output: Se ha informado de mucho trabajo sobre DMSs con diferentes semiconductores de II-VI y III-V como material base, como,
ZnS
, CdS, GaN, ZnO, ZnSe, ZnTe, TiO2, SnO2 [4–12].
